website_summaries.verdict: Relying on a power cord isn’t all bad, especially when users need both high rpm and torque. Users are happy with its performance on small sanding and polishing projects (trimming pets' nails, smoothing 3D-printed items).
pros: Corded tool w/reliable power and torque
Works best on smaller polishing and sanding projects
35,000 rpm setting gets the job done for most
cons: Collet can be difficult to work with when attaching accessories
the wrong size occasionally ships with unit, causing frustration

customer_reviews.title: Light and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Originally ordered the 3000 but had to send it back as it had issues with the variable speed control switch. Glad I ordered this one as the two speeds are enough and I think the smaller size will make it easier to control. I prefer the dremel brand as they have a reputation for longevity ( father has an old 200 and has really put it to the test over the last 15 years or so. Be sure to read the manual and let run for 5 minutes with no attachments to seat the motor brushes, very important !!! Do wish it came with a case but there are second party companies that make universal cases.
customer_reviews.author: Happy2helpU2

customer_reviews.title: Best model for your money
customer_reviews.text: We use these daily at work for cutting and trimming all sorts of metals and wood. Actually we wear out at least one a year and have tried all different models and manufacturers. However, we always go back to buying these. They are inexpensive, built like a tank and not difficult to repair when the brushes wear out. They simply work.
customer_reviews.author: spotco2

customer_reviews.title: Happy to update this review if dremel offers a solution
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about getting my first dremel until i realized that the collet is too small to fit any of the included bits? Happy to update this review if dremel offers a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Brosenau

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool for trimming a dogs nails!
customer_reviews.text: I love using this for my dogs nails, no more having to hurt him with the normal nail clippers. The electric nail trimmer they sell in the pet stores, is a joke. This does all nails in no time. I am so glad I bought this. I'd recommend this to any dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: BillyJo

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok, but it’s hard to hold.
customer_reviews.text: I wished I got the one that I can pair my hand tool (drill) to it, but off course I get the one that you can not attach it to the hand peace See photo no 2 is my old hand peace, might have to get one that can be connected to it, it’s very big to hold,
customer_reviews.author: A. A.

customer_reviews.title: low speed is margional
customer_reviews.text: This tool is not the same as one I purchased a few years ago (perhaps 6-10 years). The first one I received was useless on the low speed. I don't think it ever got past about 3000 RPM and sounded like a bad bearing all the time. It was replaced with one which mostly works. It typically takes 30-60 sec to get up to speed on the low setting. When it eventually does it is at 13000 RPM no load. I suppose that is close enough to the advertised 15000 RPM. Clearly the speed control has been changed and not for the better. The high speed setting seems the same as all other Dremmel tools, reasonably powerful.
customer_reviews.author: mhubel

customer_reviews.title: Used to cut metal effortlessly
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut a little bit of the metal dash in my Vintage Volkswagen Beetle because I added some extra gauges, little hack saws weren't cutting it. This product did the trick perfectly and effortlessly and cut the dash in mere seconds. Very happy with my purchase! Reasonable price and fast shipping too!
customer_reviews.author: RugbyGirl

customer_reviews.title: classic tool
customer_reviews.text: Included accessories are very basic, but available through many 3rd parties, so not an issue. Lightweight, small, compact, but high rpm for a small package. I would have preferred more than 2 speed settings, but that model is much bigger and heavier. Comes with a nice manual with instructions on how to use accessories and which materials they can be used on, which was lacking when I purchased a Dremel 10 yrs ago. This is for lightweight work such as crafts and hobbies.
customer_reviews.author: no-nonsense

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I went ahead and purchased the corded dremel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to dremel to use on my dogs nails. I had used the battery operated dremel and I was tired of replacing batteries. I then tried rechargeable, the rechargeable dremel just did not seem to hold a full charge long enough for me to dremel multiple dogs at the same time. I am glad I went ahead and purchased the corded dremel. I would recommend this dremel.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for hobbies
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for the first time to help with building models. It is my new favorite tool. Thera are many attachments to choose from and the build quality is great. If I had one little bit of criticism to offer, it might be to make the way the rotary tool is meant to be gripped. If should be reshaped to somewhat resemble a gripping hand. This might make offer improved handling by the user. Also move the power switch! It's in an inconvenient location and you have to be careful when releasing your grip to switch it on and off. But overall, it's a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: DCdevil

customer_reviews.title: Not as described - don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I use dremels with flex shaft on a daily basis to buff my polymer clay pieces. I need over 8000 rpm for a good buff, so normally when I saw this I thought it's perfect (I like to have 2 or 3 to be able to switch if they get warm). This dremel does NOT put out even 15k rpm, forget about the 35k! First speed is barely there, second is MAYBE 6000 rpm. If you're looking for a high speed dremel this is not the one.
customer_reviews.author: Doina "Day" Berndt dba Kalyana Design

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for dog nails
customer_reviews.text: I've done hundreds of thousands of dog nails in my lifetime, and I'm here to tell you this Dremel is not what you want for your dog. It's too powerful, even on low, heats up too fast, and is nowhere near as comfortable for the dogs as the cordless models. Additionally it is H-E-A-V-Y, and had I not returned it, I'm sure I'd have carpal tunnel within weeks. It might be wonderful for big man hands doing big man jobs, but for a dog girl this is a very bad choice.
customer_reviews.author: Sleeplessdomore

customer_reviews.title: Hasnt let me down
customer_reviews.text: I love, love my dremel tool, its versatile, can be used for many jobs, very convenient too. Ive used it to prep metal by sanding away rust spots and prep for painting surfaces, it does the job nicely. I havent used it for anything demanding, so i cant tell you, but its a great tool
customer_reviews.author: maribel sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Dremel 200 two speed rotary tool kit
customer_reviews.text: I usually purchase a variable speed dremel but I have found that most of the time I am running it at maximum speed, so when the last Dremel failed I ordered this two speed unit. It arrived quickly and has all the Dremel quality. I select between one of the two speeds and do my work. I can't justify, for myself, the need for more variability. I am very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: dgeorge

customer_reviews.title: Great Pet Nail Grinders
customer_reviews.text: WTF, these things are great. They cost about 30% less than the pet nail grinders do, and can be used for a multitude of other things around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Public

customer_reviews.title: You might have to spend some time learning how to use it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a couple small projects. Actually turned out to be a great tool for my current job. Not sure why it’s 40+ dollars though, some of the cutting wheels are cheap and break easy.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Dremels are so cool. I've had the cordless one and it's neat but this thing is crazy. I didn't expect it to be as strong as it is. Use it for burnishing leather edges and it's got more than enough juice even on 'low'. Also picked up the little drill press table they make for it and that's cool too. Makes for a cheap and versatile press.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pet Manicures and Pedicures
customer_reviews.text: I love this product because of its small size. It feels good in my hand and is less cumbersome than the larger models for delicate projects like trimming my dog's and cat's nails. I'd definitely buy this again if the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Barreto

customer_reviews.title: A must-have in any workshop
customer_reviews.text: Invaluable tool, whether you do arts & crafts, furniture, or like me, auto restoration. I had my last one for 12 years before it finally gave up the ghost. I decided I could live without the variable speed feature. The knockoff versions (Harbor Freight, etc.) do not even come close in speed, power or quality.
customer_reviews.author: clarity

customer_reviews.title: Made a great birthday present.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son in law who wore out my old one. I got a much better one but decided to get this for him to accompany the new drill and bit pack I got him for his birthday. He was happy with it so I can give it four stars. Dremel products are always reliable and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nashoba Losa

customer_reviews.title: Corded Version
customer_reviews.text: This is the corded version of my other Dremel which I use for trimming my dogs' nails. I just couldn't stand having to charge the cordless one anymore, so opted for these.
customer_reviews.author: Karin A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trimming dog's nails
customer_reviews.text: Love this for shortening my dogs' nails. Cordless sounds nice but they are a pain over time. This is just right and my husband won't steal it. Recommend diamond 1/2" wheel - purchased separately - to really make toenail trimming a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Functions
customer_reviews.text: I absolutly love this item. I do a lot of DIY around the house and this thing does everything from predrill holes to cutting plastic and wood. I used for fixing my hollow doors in my home (as well as changing out knobes and making new holes for latches) and other small miscellaneous fixes as well. Thanks so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Small

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Should Have One!
customer_reviews.text: Crazy tool. I would've never expected such a little tool to be so strong. I used it to cut a hole on the side of my car to wire tuck the harness. This little Dremel took it like a champ. I also purchased the pack that brings a bunch of extras, I recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you purchase correct  Dremel + accessories packaging deceiving to me
customer_reviews.text: Apparently I thought Dremel came with the cutting tools I wanted and needed but not knowing terminology apparently got wrong tool and have never been able to use this product to its potential. Actually instructions don't provide basics for optional uses with tools provided and none server purpose I need.
customer_reviews.author: Betts

customer_reviews.title: Get Rid of Toenail Fungus
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to some comments. I purchased this to grind down my toenails. I’m trying to get rid of toenail fungus. Be carefully though, as this spins very fast. Also, only 2 of the attachments work on toenails.
customer_reviews.author: Rezonator

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool that works great. Should be in every toolbox.
customer_reviews.text: Handy tool that works great. I was able to cut off a spring that had broken inside a chair. The space was too small for a saw, but the dremel tool took care of it. Next up: removing grout with the grout remover.
customer_reviews.author: LS in PDX

customer_reviews.title: Not for toe nails
customer_reviews.text: I can't rate the tool as it was never used. It was listed as something for trimming thick toe nails but an insert in the box specifically says it should not be used for medical or veterinary purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Grant

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly and does what ti is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to figure out how to change the bits, but once I understood the two parts that need to spin, and how to hold them to remove and insert the bits, it worked well. I am a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: An observent customer

customer_reviews.title: Fills all of my needs
customer_reviews.text: The 2-speed replaces my variable speed that I have used for twenty years. I found that I was usually only using a very low speed and the highest speed anyway. I use my Dremel to cut off metal bolts, score a new slot in a screw head, polish metal, smooth down a Bondo patch, notch out wood, sharpen saw blades and more
customer_reviews.author: String Tones

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I had never owned a Dremel rotary before this purchase and figured it would be a great thing to have for my DIY projects. The tool did not dissapoint. I actually used it on a project the following day after getting it and it was super easy to work with. The lower setting wasn't so great because it wasn't powerful enough to cut through plastic, but the high setting had no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Worked great then one day just stopped right in the middle of use. I haven't even owned them 1 year and I can't get them to work at all anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Keriya Mayhue

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for women to use. Makes quick work off drilling holes in shells and sea stones.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. I drill holes in sea shells for making jewelry and it works great. I did buy a small diamond tip bit and everything works great!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Wade

customer_reviews.title: Great product with two speeds and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Dremel It has a slow and a fast speed which make it perfect for grinding my dogs nails. I wish it had some options for purchasing additional sanding wheels when you purchase the Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: DoxieK9

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog nails
customer_reviews.text: I use theses to Dremel my dogs' nails. Works great and SO much cheaper than taking to a groomer or vet, pays for itself with 2 or 3 uses.
customer_reviews.author: CareyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Drilled sea glass!
customer_reviews.text: Hey, whaddaya know! I drilled sea glass and didn't drill a hole in my finger! Never used one of these before, but this thing is easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Pink

customer_reviews.title: Cords are good! Battery never dies.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Dremel tool for trimming my dogs nails (yep) and for fine sanding tasks. I had a cordless tool previously. Eventually, it would die and I’d have to wait for it to charge. That’s not the case with this one! It came with multi- heads for different jobs. Great value for my simple tasks.
customer_reviews.author: acarolinemcl

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried that wasn't powerful enough the work with, but I've been using mine for 3 weeks and the performance is really good. Great value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Johnny V

customer_reviews.title: Great product, missing a few things.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother. Looks and works great. The only complaint is that it did not come with the right little metal pieces to keep the additional accessories it came with in place.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Q.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool that you don't realize you need until you ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool that you don't realize you need until you have it. Trust me, you will find yourself using it all the time. I probably would have preferred the cordless model, but it's a trade off. Easy portability with the cordless vs more power and never having to wait for a charge. Can't really go wrong either way.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I had a very bad rusted 02 sensor that I couldnt get a hold on due to where its located it cut threw the 02 sensor like butter awesome
customer_reviews.author: Rizzey

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to operate and hold
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on my feet. If that's what you're needing it for be careful because it's easy to apply too much pressure
customer_reviews.author: Caddyman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Two speeds and very easy to control. I hope it lasts for years to come! Thanks Dremel
customer_reviews.author: Betty Shupe

customer_reviews.title: Package came pretty banged up and missing a part (yellow 425)
customer_reviews.text: Package came pretty banged up and missing a part (yellow 425) . Can't find a way to contact anyone regarding this and it is too late to return. Happy to change rating if someone reads this and helps fix.
customer_reviews.author: Dakusan

customer_reviews.title: MUCH Better than Battery Powered!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an excellent choice over the battery operated version, and not much of a price difference, but COMPLETELY worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Zylvan

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I've needed one of these for so long I'm glad I finally got one. I was a little reluctant since this is a cheaper version but it cut down and cleaned up a bunch of metal surfaces just fine to finish my projects.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely versatile and handy tool, plus it's lightweight and easy to hold. I've found countless ways to use it both inside the house and in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: i use it for my very large dog nails! ...
customer_reviews.text: i use it for my very large dog nails! just be careful only a few seconds at a time, or you will burn them. He loves his nails done, and get excited and gets into position when i pull this tool out!!
customer_reviews.author: bh of chicago

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my Dremel Drill Press. Two speeds are fine for this type of application. A little work horse.
customer_reviews.author: Joellyn D Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Good deal , easy for my daughter to use .
customer_reviews.author: Stretch 406

customer_reviews.title: Dremel entry level
customer_reviews.text: A little under powered but will do for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Tom's Product Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk right out of the box. Horrible instructions. Buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Trojansky

customer_reviews.title: Good package
customer_reviews.text: Comes with everything you need to get started. Easy to use and a pretty long cord.
customer_reviews.author: Amberly Prime

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my DIY projects
customer_reviews.text: I am using it for my DIY projects. Love arts and crafts. Right now I am restoring antique lamps for my home. Because I have arthritis, sanding cause me a lot of pain. This Dremel is perfect for sanding. I should buy it before!!!
customer_reviews.author: maribel feliciano

customer_reviews.title: I am sorry to say that, but after 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry to say that, but after 5 minutes of work, it just died. Heard 2 pops inside of it, and then it died.
customer_reviews.author: Kirill

customer_reviews.title: Second one has quit working.
customer_reviews.text: Quit working the second time I went to use it. I was simply cutting a zip tie in a hard to reach location. Won’t turn on. I’m now outside the 60 day window. This is my second one. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Rose

customer_reviews.title: FAST AND FURIOUS!
customer_reviews.text: Omigosh! My hubby wore out his battery operated one in less than a year fixing all the stuff I break! THIS THING ZOOMS LIKE A CHARM! I can barely break stuff fast enough to keep up with it!
customer_reviews.author: K.L.B.

customer_reviews.title: Dog pedicure.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to trim my dogs nails. Works wonderfully. Not loud. Doesn't frighten my dog and the low speed it just right as not to rip his nails off. Just be careful not to get his coat or your hair in the bit. The dog would end up with a bald spot and you could end up with knotted tight dreadlocks. I know, I lost a small section of my bangs and my dog had a pink skin spot on his leg...he moved.
customer_reviews.author: Review Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: better than cheaper brands
customer_reviews.text: originally spent less and bought a walmart brand. It died and it wasn't the brushes. this is a workhorse
customer_reviews.author: Doug Brozell

customer_reviews.title: Great tool well worth the money it's great.
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool kit very handy and does everything I need it to do and you can always buy more attachments for it.
customer_reviews.author: Killabee-23

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Dremel name says it all, small versital, covers all your etching n engraving needs
customer_reviews.author: Dani C

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: This Dremel is a must have, there isn’t anything it can’t do. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: MEbe

customer_reviews.title: the must have tool in every home and studio
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tool so much in the last month. As an artist, I have tried all kinds of new media and the ones I already work with, glass, metal, and wood all making creating easier
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: dremel is a girls best friend!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy anything other than dremel. been using since I was a kid. if I could give more stars I would. dremel is a girls bff. I installed an air conditioner window kit at work.....only possible with a dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool
customer_reviews.text: It has quite a few attachments. I’m very pleased with the selection that came with my Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected, nice tool for the price range. Great for small home projects and hobbies.
customer_reviews.author: Hanny1

customer_reviews.title: Same great quality and usefulness
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a much older one lost or misplaced during a move. Same great quality and usefulness. A must-have around the house or garage
customer_reviews.author: ClarksonFace

customer_reviews.title: You'll Be Suprised
customer_reviews.text: This is an indispensable tool. You'll buy it for a particular need - I needed to lower a door jam just a tad - and then discover you can use it to do so much more. This tool gets regular use and you can find all kinds of usage ideas online if you do a web search. I don't regret this purchase at all and the price was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Gadget Freak

customer_reviews.title: Love the Dremel so far
customer_reviews.text: Love the Dremel so far. The low speed doesn't have a lot of power although I'm sure there are some uses for that speed. High speed works great for what I have used it for. Tons of different attachments for this.
customer_reviews.author: K. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog nails.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use for trimming/filing dog nails. Works great for that. I haven't tried using it for anything else (yet).
customer_reviews.author: LCW

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tool from a reputable company.
customer_reviews.text: This is to replace a black and decker rotary tool which died in about six months of light use. I already like this one better. It contains more accessories than the black and decker. And it's more reliable. I should have bought this one first.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: Replaces and old one we'd had for years and used daily. We own several of these for our shop and they always do a great job and last for years if you take care of them.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Tanar

customer_reviews.title: Works great comes in handy
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked great for cutting metal. Used it to cut a screw and other metals. Comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I love this Dremel
customer_reviews.text: I use for everything in my hous, even sanding my pups nails. It's quiet and gets the job done. It also cuts through metal very well. I love this Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Best tool I’ve ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: I use this Dremel all the time for crafts and projects.
customer_reviews.author: Noah K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We love the Dremel. It is so versatile. Just this weekend, we used it to help repair our water heater. The tips and accessories seem endless. The Dremel is durable and is very comfortable to hold. We decided on a corded version and so far, that hasn't created any problems. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: LeiyahElamadri

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This Dremel was great for crafts as well as gel manicures! Very impressed. Easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Brookelynn

customer_reviews.title: Its an awsome tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this tool is awesome. My husband just loves it and has done so much with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Essential tool
customer_reviews.text: It's a Dremel! Worth paying more than the generic rotary tools because I can find all the attachments and deal with warranty issues locally.
customer_reviews.author: BMC

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to replace an old dremel I'd had for ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old dremel I'd had for years and it's battery would no longer hold a charge. This is a little more heavy duty and should serve me well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Like the 2 speeds
customer_reviews.text: Used for cutting my glass that I use in flameworking!
customer_reviews.author: John P Kolb Jr

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my uncle who does nails and he had no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: This dremel has been a great tool in accomplishment a finished product with the projects ...
customer_reviews.text: This dremel has been a great tool in accomplishment a finished product with the projects that I have taken on!
customer_reviews.author: CAPTAIN SLACKBEARD

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: It works great and I have used it on 3 projects
customer_reviews.author: Ranita Keener

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Thanks so much!!!! Great quality and fast shipping! Price was awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fabulous Scraps

customer_reviews.title: Nice Dremel Quality
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 35 year old unit. For use in garage. mostly sharpening lawn mower blades. Works well and comes with nice basic selection of accessories.
customer_reviews.author: waltbobjr

customer_reviews.title: Great for small cutting jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I had a small job where I was cutting a heavy duty plastic tool box and this tool was up to the task.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rubin

customer_reviews.title: dremel
customer_reviews.text: given as a gift and son very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Duran

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: Could not be more pleased. Took a bit to get here as backordered however they kept me informed. Could not ask for betteer
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Garner

customer_reviews.title: Dremel Can't be Beat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old Dremel that died after using for a large kitchen backsplash job. I hope this one lasts!
customer_reviews.author: Sunmom2

customer_reviews.title: Too Slow & Too Fast
customer_reviews.text: I returned it because the low speed was too low for my use and the high speed was too high. Customer service suggested that I invest in a variable speed Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Roses_Three

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are pretty weak.
customer_reviews.text: doesn't last very long​. After a year we needed a new one. Batteries are pretty weak.
customer_reviews.author: RobbieRob

customer_reviews.title: Good good good
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. Accidently left it at a friend's house when I went back home. Use it for a lot of different things
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: not powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: this isn't powerful enough to do much, only very lightweight jobs
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K. Cox

customer_reviews.title: It's a Dremel and it works
customer_reviews.text: Needed a Dremel for some small projects. I've used it twice so far and it seems to work well. Happy with the variety of tools it came with, but may need more for future projects.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Has all the tools I need in this one package.
customer_reviews.author: carter3L

customer_reviews.title: this is great.
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this for refinements for projects on high school tech crew. He loves it. Seems durable. A higher speed and stronger motor might help in the future, but for his needs, this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love my Dremel​. What else is there to say?
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N. Burson

customer_reviews.title: Good but no case.
customer_reviews.text: Good tool and satisfied with it but wished it had come with a case.
customer_reviews.author: M. Domer

customer_reviews.title: Great $$ value!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for with more torque than I expected. Great $$ value!
customer_reviews.author: K. Shustak

product_meta.title: Dremel 200-1/15 Two-Speed Rotary Tool Kit
product_meta.description:
Style:Rotary kitA great addition to any toolbox or jobsite, The Dremel rotary tool is ideal for multiple applications and materials. The 2-Speed control allows you to set your speed at 15, 000 or 35, 000 RPM with just the flip of a switch. The cool running ball bearing construction ensures a smooth and quiet operation, while the lightweight design allows for increased comfort during prolonged use. Made to last, It features replaceable motor brushes, which extend the life of the tool. Extremely handy, The tool comes with the following accessories: Lawn mower and garden tool sharpener, high speed cutter, 401 Mandrel, 402 Mandrel, 407 coarse 1/2" Sanding drum, 408 coarse 1/2" Sanding band, 420 heavy duty Emery Cut-Off wheel, 421 polishing compound, 422 cone polishing tip, 425 Emery wheel, 426 1-1/4" Fiberglass-reinforced Cut-Off wheel, 429 large felt wheel, 432 1/2" 120 grit sanding band, 932 aluminum Oxide grinding Stone, 8193 aluminum Oxide grinding Stone, 83322 silicon carbide grinding Stone.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Dremel 200 Series rotary tool offers the precision and control required to complete a wide range of projects. Its two speed settings allow you to use the low speed setting for cleaning applications and using brush accessories and the high speed setting for routing, cutting and sanding applications.
feature_bullets: Designed for a smooth, quiet operation
Lightweight construction allows for comfort during prolonged use

specifications.Included Components: High Speed Cutter, 402 Mandrel, 421 Polishing Compound, 83322 Silicon Carbide Grinding Stone, 426 1-1/4" Fiberglass-Reinforced Cut-Off Wheel, 422 Cone Polishing Tip, 432 1/2" 120 Grit Sanding Band, Lawn Mower and Garden Tool Sharpener, 408 Coarse 1/2" Sanding Band, 420 Heavy Duty Emery Cut-Off Wheel, 8193 Aluminum Oxide Grinding Stone, 425 Emery Wheel, 932 Aluminum Oxide Grinding Stone, 407 Coarse 1/2" Sanding Drum, 401 Mandrel, 429 Large Felt Wheel
